uk.ac.macaulay.util
Class XColorName

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.macaulay.util.XColorName

public final class XColorName
extends java.lang.Object

Provide a map from X windows colour names to Java Colors.

Author:
Gary Polhill

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Create a Java Enum containing all the XColors

Parameters:

get

public static java.awt.Color get(java.lang.String name)
Return the Color for the specified name. This will be null if the name isn't found.

Parameters:
name - the name of the colour
Returns:
the Color

rgbInJar

public static boolean rgbInJar()
The rgb.txt was loaded via the class loader, and so was found that way.

Returns:
true if rgb.txt was found locally, false if we had to search for it

foundRGB

public static boolean foundRGB()
The rgb.txt was successfully loaded

Returns:
true if rgb.txt was successfully loaded.

rgbReadException

public static java.io.IOException rgbReadException()
Any exception that occurred when reading rgb.txt

Returns:
The exception that occurred when reading rgb.txt or null

whereRGBFound

public static java.lang.String whereRGBFound()
Where the RGB was found

Returns:
Where the rgb.txt was found, or null if it wasn't

readColors

private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.awt.Color> readColors()
Read in the colours from rgb.txt, a copy of which should be included in the Jar file this class appears in. If not, however, we try looking for the file in some popular predefined locations.

Returns:
A map from String to Color of the colors as they are read in from rgb.txt, or an empty map if rgb.txt could not be found

readColors

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.awt.Color> readColors(java.lang.String filename)
                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
Read a map of name to colour from any file with a format similar to rgb.txt

Parameters:
filename - The file to load
Returns:
A colour name to Color map
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readColors

private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.awt.Color> readColors(java.io.InputStream stream,
                                                                         java.lang.String filename)
                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
Read a map of name to colour from any stream

Parameters:
stream - The stream to read from
filename - The name associated with the stream
Returns:
The colour map
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readColors

private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.awt.Color> readColors(java.io.BufferedReader bufferedReader,
                                                                         java.lang.String filename)
                                                                  throws java.io.IOException
Main read method. The file is assumed to be formatted with # comments, and then three integers for red, green and blue, followed by the name of the colour on the rest of the line

Parameters:
bufferedReader - The reader to read from
filename - The name associated with the reader
Returns:
The map
Throws:
java.io.IOException

findRGBTXT

private static java.lang.String findRGBTXT()
Search in various known locations for rgb.txt

Returns:
A full path to the file, or null

rebuildPath

private static java.lang.String rebuildPath(java.lang.String path)
Reconstruct a path from a filename. The input is a path separated in UNIX style (/), the output is a path with files separated using whatever the local separator character is.

Parameters:
path - UNIX-formatted path
Returns:
local-formatted path
